title: Patterned Fills for ggplot2 and grid Graphics
text: fillpattern streamlines process adding distinctive yet unobtrusive geometric patterns place solid grob/geom fills. resultant figures look just professional viewed colorblind readers printed black white. Compared similar ggpattern package, fillpattern: dependencies beyond base R ggplot2. Works ggplot2::geom_* functions. Focuses simple geometric patterns.

title: Patterned Fills for ggplot2 and grid Graphics
text: Simply add scale_fill_pattern() ggplot.  Works geom_bar(), geom_boxplot(), geom_violin(), geom_* functions accept fill aesthetic.
code: library(ggplot2) library(fillpattern)  ggplot(mpg, aes(x = class, color = drv, fill = drv)) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_pattern()

title: Patterned Fills for ggplot2 and grid Graphics

code: library(grid) library(fillpattern)  grid.newpage() grid.circle( gp = gpar(fill = fill_pattern("grid")), x = 1/4, r = 3/8) grid.rect(   gp = gpar(fill = fill_pattern("fish")), width = 1/5, height = 3/4) grid.polygon(gp = gpar(fill = fill_pattern("brick")), x = c(6,7,5)/8, y = c(7,1,1)/8)

title: Patterned Fills for Grobs — fill_pattern
text: patterns, pattern pattern specification. Options "brick", "chevron", "fish", "grid", "herringbone", "hexagon", "octagon", "rain", "saw", "shingle", "rshingle", "stripe", "wave", optionally abbreviated /suffixed modifiers. See "Pattern Names" section . Default: "brick" fg Foreground color, pattern's lines. Default: "black" bg Background color (grob). Default: "transparent" angle much rotate pattern, given degrees clockwise. Default: 0 width width pattern tile. Assumed millimeters unless set otherwise unit(). Default: 5 height height pattern tile, NA match width. Assumed millimeters unless set otherwise unit(). Default: NA lwd Line width. positive number. See graphics::par() additional details. Default: 1 lty Line type. One "solid", "dashed", "dotted", "dotdash", "longdash", "twodash". See graphics::par() additional details. Default: "solid" fun function modifying graphical parameters immediately rendering. accept two parameters: env, environment function modify, row, row transformed data ggbuild constructed grob (including aes mappings). function return gTree error force returning parent function immediately, NULL continue processing updated env. Default: NULL min_size Minimum size pattern draw. Applies width height. Useful avoiding CPU memory overhead tiny graphical elements. Assumed millimeters unless set otherwise unit(). Default: 2

title: Patterned Fills for Grobs — fill_pattern
text: fill_pattern() returns list grid::pattern() objects; fillPatternGrob() returns grid::gTree() object.

title: Patterned Fills for Grobs — fill_pattern
text: fillPatternGrob() expects single value parameter. fill_pattern() can accept vector values parameter subset recycled needed obtain number length(patterns).

title: Patterned Fills for Grobs — fill_pattern
text: Base name: Pattern names must always begin one "brick", "chevron", "fish", "grid", "herringbone", "hexagon", "octagon", "rain", "saw", "shingle", "rshingle", "stripe", "wave". names support partial matching, e.g. "", "herring", "herringbone" valid. However, tiling designs may added future, recommended use full names finished code. Angle modifier: number immediately following tiling design, "stripe45", "fish180", "saw20". added angle argument; fill_pattern("brick45", angle=45) equivalent fill_pattern("brick90"). Width height modifier: underscore followed single size used width height. , underscore followed new width height separated colon. Can absolute sizes ("grid_4" "hex_5mm:0.1npc") relative width height arguments ("saw_sm" "brick_*2:/2"). shorthand values "xs", "sm", "md", "lg", "xl" equivalent "/4", "/2", "1", "*2", "*4", respectively. Line width style: underscore, followed number, followed one "solid", "dashed", "dotted", "dotdash", "longdash", "twodash". example, "shingle_0.5dashed" "wave_2solid". number component optional, "oct_longdash" also valid, use lwd line width. specify just line width, suffix number "lwd": "grid_2lwd" use lty line style. Combinations: Modifiers can combined order. example, "hex_lg:xl_2dotted" "grid45_dashed_1.4lwd_:6mm_sm:".

title: Patterned Fills for Grobs — fill_pattern
code: library(grid)     library(fillpattern)          grid.newpage()     grid.rect(gp = gpar(fill = fill_pattern("brick", bg = "gray", angle = 90)))           grid.newpage()     gp <- Map(gpar, fill = fill_pattern(       patterns = c("grid_3lwd", "stripe_longdash", "herringbone45", "hexagon_lg"),       fg       = c("black",     "white",           "black",         "blue"),       bg       = c("white",     "black",           "cyan",          "beige") ))     grid.circle( gp = gp[[1]], x = 1/4, y = 3/4, r = 1/5)     grid.polygon(gp = gp[[2]], x = c(9,12,15)/16, y = c(15,9,15)/16)     grid.rect(   gp = gp[[3]], x = 1/4, y = 1/4, width = 2/5, height = 2/5)     grid.rect(   gp = gp[[4]], x = 3/4, y = 1/4, width = 2/5, height = 2/5)
